website_summaries.verdict: Fast and massive, the Seagate Backup Plus Desktop is an excellent backup drive for any USB 3.0-enabled computer or server.
pros: The Seagate Backup Plus Desktop is capacious, fast, flexible, and affordable
The drive includes valuable backup software
cons: The Seagate Dashboard backup software doesn't allow for keeping multiple versions of data, nor does it work with non-Seagate drives
The two-year warranty is short for a drive of such capacity

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Seagate fan no longer
customer_reviews.text: Loyal Seagate fan no longer. Pushed the USB cable in to the drive and the connector inside the case disappears inside and rattles around. Disk now unreadable. You can see where the connector "wasn't" soldered to the circuit board. Sound like a manufacturing defect ? Not so - according to Seagate. You call for warranty support - which is way to short - and they tell you that "disks fail --- anything else we can help you with?" Very disappointed with what used to be excellent products and support.
customer_reviews.author: Melnic

customer_reviews.title: I love how it allows itself to format itself to the ...
customer_reviews.text: All in all I bought for my PS4.I love how it allows itself to format itself to the right one to work with the system.I got the 8 terabyte so definitely a little overkill.Now, a word of caution!!!! If this thing gets disconnected improperly in any way it will reset itself and you would have to reformat and delete everything resulting in downloading everything over again.I forgot my light switch was connected to the outlet I was using my system on and I switched it off improperly I was pissed
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Komar

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive failed--potentially lost 3 years of photos (photographer)
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive fails to connect--disconnecting constantly. I've tried multiple ports, computers, cords and chargers--it's definitely the hard drive itself. I'll update this once I go to a data recovery center, but that a hard drive that's done nothing but sit on my desk with intermittent use, just to hold old photos, would fail like this...it had one job, and it failed. I'm distraught by the potential loss, but trying to keep my cool. And yes, I had backup plans (cloud), in which the cloud backup "upgraded" and deleted all my backed up data until that point, and so the new backup hasn't fully caught up...or maybe this is why it never seemed to progress.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Kao

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE OUT OF THE BOX: DON'T BUY IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The free 200 gig cloud storage that "comes" with this is a HOAX! Every time I set it up, it says "invalid password." I couldn't set up this so-called "state of the art" drive. Hired a technician to set it up. Even with his help, we keep getting an "INVALID PARTITION TABLE" error message each time the drive starts up. I've never had such a defective item OUT OF THE BOX. Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.author: R. Zamora

customer_reviews.title: The only thing is that I was expecting Backup to be simple and easy and to include the O/S
customer_reviews.text: No big issues so far. A year in. The only thing is that I was expecting Backup to be simple and easy and to include the O/S. Unfortunately the backup schedule doesn't always seem to run and doesn't give a good enough confirmation that it's actually backing up. I couldn't figure out how to back up the O/S folders as well either. I scoured the manufacturer website and other forums and found things to try but none of them fixed the issue. I got backups working fine, and everything else seems fine. The only thing I have issue with is backing up the O/S.
customer_reviews.author: Cobalt TiNor

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted, though a little bulky. Requires external power.
customer_reviews.text: Just died. It was good while it lasted, but I'd like to get more than 2 years out of a drive. Losing 5TB is no joke. It's also hard to backup to the cloud because most ISPs don't upload all that fast. (Obviously unrelated to the quality of the drive) Just bought a Drobo that holds multiple drives and has data redundancy because I don't trust these large capacity external drives anymore. As this is the second or third one to go from either Seagate or Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Died 17 months later
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little hard drive for the price I got it, until it pooped out 17 months after purchasing. It will no longer spin at all. I had a hard drive technician look at it, and he says the problem is unusual and can't be fixed. The drive is still under warranty, but Seagate will only pay for shipping one way. I would have to pay to ship the drive to California with very specific, hard to meet requirements about my packaging. And even with all that, the data would not be recovered, but a new blank drive sent back. Seagate intentionally makes it difficult and unaffordable to replace a faulty drive.
customer_reviews.author: Rae King

customer_reviews.title: The perfect external drive if you want to own crap
customer_reviews.text: Bought August 2017, died tonight backing up my imac. This is a piece of crap, I ordered two and the first night one died and I was able to send it back. Wouldnt mount tonight, I usually back things up once a week, so this makes two that have failed. I will NEVER, got that, NEVER buy seagate crap again. Made and assembled in every other country than the USA, Im moving to a more reliable external drive solution. No wonder it was on sale.
customer_reviews.author: denny_sf

customer_reviews.title: Avoid 8tb at all cost - Totally unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 8tb model in Feb of 2016, failed in March. RMA's and was replaced, and that failed in August. RMA'd again and replaced, and now that has failed in Jan. Have lost all faith in Seagate external drives - cannot more strongly recommend that you NEVER buy a SeaGate USB external harddrive. This is one of those cases that if I could award NEGATIVE stars, I would, it does not even rate 0 stars John
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Even Last a Year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive less than a year, and it started failing to copy files for "Unknown Error" reasons, and Scanning & Repairing the Drive every time my PC reboots, for the last couple months. I would have said something sooner, but I recently upgraded my PC, and I thought maybe the fault was in my old one which had a USB 3.0 card added some years after I first bought it. Maybe I just got a bad 'un, but on balance? I'd say this external drive's a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Liebe

customer_reviews.title: Beware, be very careful.
customer_reviews.text: i transferred a very large file to the drive and it just disappeared. Contacted Seagate and we are in the fourth exchange of emails without coming anywhere near resolving the issue so I googled the problem and it seems to be quite common with very complicated solutions not within my capability. The file seems to be there it is occupying space but can't be seen. Seagate know about the problem but seem to have no simple solution and very unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Happy.
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 1 and a half year as a backup drive. It's been working perfectly even though I dropped it once to the ground by accident. I had no protection cover or anything around it, and it was solid ground that the drive fell to, not carpet. After this incident, I can say that this drive is quite reliable, sturdy and durable. I have never had any problem using it. It can become quite slow if you store a lot of stuff, and it is not an unusual thing to happen. I haven't experienced the heat problem despite many comments mentioning it. By far I am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Phuong H. Le

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have digitized all of our movies so that we don't have to hunt up the DVDs when we want to watch one. We have around 1025 movies, taking up just under 2 TB of disk space. Fits right beside our Blu-Ray player, plugs into its USB port, and is controlled by the player's remote.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: My go to drive for backups and external storage.
customer_reviews.text: I have several external drives, but this is now my go to drive for backups and external storage. It may not be the absolute fastest drive out there, but it handles USB 3.0, it's very reliable and has a 5TB capacity for the best bang for the buck factor. I keep forgetting how much space is actually on this drive so there is no issues with large backups. It will also turn off when the USB port powers down, if your PC has that feature. Some stay powered on. Great for LInux and Windows, which is what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RELIABLE HIGH-CAPACITY EXTERNAL BACKUP DRIVE!
customer_reviews.text: This large capacity hard drive is very powerful and reliable. I have been using it for years to back up my important files and it works perfectly, just make sure you update the software to the latest version and set up your backup plans properly. Since the drive has such a large capacity, it can be used to save an image of your computer on a separate hard drive that does not have any other files and you will sleep better in case something happens with your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Anton G.

customer_reviews.title: It is still a good drive at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: My criticism is that it's very difficult to determine exactly what HD is within the case prior to purchase, and drive model and speed (rpm) are not listed in product specs making it very difficult to know what you are getting. This unit is identified on Amazon as STDT4000100, and my research found the specs for that part number to have a drive speed of 7200 rpm. When the product was received I found the HD itself to be an ST4000DM000, which has a drive speed of 5980 rpm. It is still a good drive at a fair price, but it is not the drive I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gossett

customer_reviews.title: Superior Drive Both In Brand and Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing hard drive for storing tons of video projects. I have about half of my current one almost full of projects and still have room for more projects. One thing to remember; since this is a USB 3.0 drive, it will not work on a Windows XP machine unless it is networked from a Windows 7 or higher machine as I found out after first buying a USB 3.0 hard drive. The way that the Windows XP machine can read the drive with no problems is by simply mapping the drive through your home network after it is shared on the machine that can read it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Don't ever unplug it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in March of 2017. It lasted me till November 9, 2018 when I had to move the Hard Drive to my new location. When I went to plug the USB cable into the drive, the part that connects fell off into the case. I tried my best to pull it out but it completely fell inside and just rattles around, when I try to shake it back down. I had to take the drive to a shop to take apart the case (I didn't want to risk damaging the hard drive further). I purchased AmazonBasics 3.5-inches SATA Hard Drive Enclosure - USB 3.0 and used that and it's sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Neocean

customer_reviews.title: My hands can feel temperature and my hearing is good. So I am not too sure what it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have read some reviews here about heating problems where this drive gets very hot and is also noisy. I have had this drive running for over 24 hours and have not experienced any of those issues. My hands can feel temperature and my hearing is good. So I am not too sure what it is all about. Data transfer is fine. Fast enough and it does not miss a beat. Update. The drive being used on a loaded Mac slows down imaging software to a crawl for load up times and save times. I have to shut it down when working on new image files. But it is not noisy and it does not heat up.
customer_reviews.author: el

customer_reviews.title: Amazing backup drives I use them to hold my Acronis ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing backup drives I use them to hold my Acronis True Image backups. And encrypted install kits for certain computers.I recommend automatically deleting the autorun.inf file within the drive... For two reason the drive with autoplay every time you plug it in which is bad if you accidentally got the drive infected. And autorun.inf can become infected in itself to launch malware onto the host machine. With any drive I recommend MCSheild or Binisoft USB Flash Drive Control software to protect yourself from outboard drive infections. These types of drives are a haven for malware if you use them to download everything to especially.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drive Reliability Issues
customer_reviews.text: So...I have been using Segate drives for years with decent reliability. This one suddenly died on me...I tried recovery software to no avail. I have lots of my personal documents on this drive and am hesitant to ship it back to them for repair. That I can see when I looked for another one I see similar complaints about reliability and heat. I pulled this one apart and wow...they did not put proper venting for any heat on this case. All the holes are on the bottom and a few at the back of the drive. I'm not sure how they expected to get rid of the heat. I'm likely to move to another brand at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Kennith Mann

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly as I needed it to.
customer_reviews.text: I had another Seagate 5TB external hard drive that became corrupted. I could read from it, but no longer could write to it. I was able to copy all the files off the corrupted drive to this new Seagate drive, erase & initialize the old one, and copy all the files back again. The process took a while. But, had one or both drives been USB 2.0, I imagine it would've taken considerably longer. So, it cost me the price of a 5TB external drive to revive my old one. But, given how much space I use these days, I'm sure this new drive will come in handy. Meanwhile it's acting as a backup drive to the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Peter LTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I bought this harddrive on May 11, 2014. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this harddrive on May 11, 2014. On October 15, 2016 it failed and I can no longer access my files and will now have to pay Seagare $99 for its hard drive file recovery program. It worked file for 2 years but beware and backup your files.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vil

customer_reviews.title: Great backup drive
customer_reviews.text: Two years of use, and no problems in sight. PRO: -huge capacity -solid interface (USB3) with replaceable cables -external power, which works better on tablet-class devices that don't provide a lot of current to their USB ports. -seagate warranty! -Sufficient bandwidth for photo editing in Lightroom. Not SSD-fast, but plenty fast for my needs. -mine has survived 2 years of intercontinental travel, hotel stays, etc. CON: -really nothing wrong with this, just some design and logic limitations. -Not intended for high-IO operations, as it is a shingled drive. Excellent for backup roles, however.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen MahanesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works on Xbox 1
customer_reviews.text: both this drive and the other cheaper 4TB seagate drives have the same HDD inside. I chose this drive because it has better cooling capacity. it works great, installs on Xbox in seconds and provides faster load times than using the internal 500GB available from the Xbox. It's only 5900 rpm so USB 3.0 wont bottleneck it at all. it seems all external drives in this price range suffer from the same rev speed ailment so no stars off. for the price, its a great drive and I look forward to filling it to the brim with Xbox 1 games.
customer_reviews.author: Big Rob 007

customer_reviews.title: Needs a physical off switch.
customer_reviews.text: This device has no on/off switch, which means you need to trust that unmounting the drive and unplugging it will power it off safely. Not something you really want to do on a crucial back up. That said, I ran it into a USB hub that has individual power switches for each port. Really though, this thing would be a lot better if it had any kind of power management.
customer_reviews.author: Max Fento̶n

customer_reviews.title: I will continue to find a way to make this work but it's beginning to like a loss at this time I will probably switch ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchase this item and as I switch to Windows 10 it started to drop off the computer at random times I have spent 2 weeks researching to find the problem and found out that this drive is not compatible with windows 10 which made me very upset. I will continue to find a way to make this work but it's beginning to like a loss at this time I will probably switch over to Western Digital even thou I have had problems in the past with them and I had like Seagate for there reliability but if I can't fix it I must change
customer_reviews.author: Ray A. Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Have two of these that I got like 16 months ago
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these that I got like 16 months ago. Still running smoothly. Make sure you properly eject the dives before unplugging them. Usually nothing happens when you just disconnect it from the usb. But man all it takes is one time and your stuff is gone! Lucky I had a full back up to replace the info on the corrupted drive. Reformatted and transferred files.
customer_reviews.author: Icedrake

customer_reviews.title: The drive is great for backing up
customer_reviews.text: The drive is great for backing up, but since the drive is very slow, copying 8tb of media files took overnight. Well, USB3 is supposed to be faster than that, isn't it? If you just want the capacity (not the external housing), buy 2 fast 4tb drives for the same price. I was going to give a 4-star rating before I found out that the USB-3 cable included was junk... It's loose and if I touch the cable accidentally, the drive would loose the connection. I bought a new cable from amazon and it works fine, so I know the connection on the drive side is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Ringochan

customer_reviews.title: Nice for people that use Windows and Mac
customer_reviews.text: The nice thing about this unit and a lot of the Seagate hard drives is their ability to be managed by both windows and MAC. You have to install some special drivers on the mac and you have to have initially formatted the drive on windows. I am writing this review to caution people that not all Seagate drives are made by Seagate, and only the units made by Seagate will work. The seagate backup plus units all seem to have this capability.
customer_reviews.author: Rod D.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with Windows 10 not assigning a drive letter
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several external drives. These 3 drives were not recognized by Windows 10 until I force assigned a drive letter in Disk Management. Not clear as to why this is happening, I have used the STEB series drives on this computer with no problems. The tech at Seagate was very helpful, only waited 10 minutes to get on line. I had determined it was a computer problem by attaching both drives to a Windows 7 machine, and both were immediately recognized, format on the partition and data on the drive. If your drive is not recognized and appears to not be formatted, try assigning a drive letter.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Junk product, not well made
customer_reviews.text: Died already just barely after a year or so... Update: sent to Seagate under RMA warranty claim and it was sent back unrepaired. I have no idea why it was sent back, but not replaced. I am not going to buy Seagate products again...Quality is not there and product does not last if you want to have a solid reliable backup device.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Yeung

customer_reviews.title: Died in one year. Warranty is a hassle
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive stopped working in just over one year. Good thing I bought the warranty. Even with the full warranty I had to pay $13 for "Shipping & Handling" for my new drive, also had to jump through a ton of hoops to get Seagate to validate the warranty. I have other external hard drives that were much less expensive and have lasted over a decade with no problems. I would not recommend this product or the Seagate company
customer_reviews.author: John Lavin

customer_reviews.title: This unit is awesome. I own two of them but returned one ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is awesome. I own two of them but returned one and the other one was damaged when Hurricane Harvey hit Texas. A major drawback was how it would not be recognized by either Mac or Windows systems. You had to pick one or the other. A great feature is the built-in password and the transfer speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great little drive with economical capacity.
customer_reviews.text: So far, in 3 weeks of use - nearly constant - this has been doing the job. I have three other Seagate drives similar with 3, 4 and 4TB. So I am hopeful this will be as good a product as those. One of those 4TB's has been continuously "on" and in use for 2 years+. Note - even with USB3 it takes a LONG TIME to fill a 8TB drive. At best about a 1/2 TB per day if the files are not huge. So order in plenty of time to fill it for your purpose.
customer_reviews.author: S. W. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on seagate.
customer_reviews.text: These drives just stop responding after a while. You can't get your data back out. I bought 2 seagates and 2 wd drives at the same time and they are in raid, and both the seagates died within a week of each other.
customer_reviews.author: sirarcher

customer_reviews.title: Great drive! It's nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great drive! It's nice and quiet, the price is perfect, and I like the design. It stands up on it's side well. The 8TB hard drives are kind of hard to come by at reasonable prices so I was a bit weary that this one was so affordable, but it's exactly what I needed. Transfer speeds seem great so far too, though I'm not doing anything that would stress it much. What I needed was a large drive to consolidate my collection of media and various backup files on, and this certainly does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: KIM JOON HAN

customer_reviews.title: Good disk, easy intallation
customer_reviews.text: Terrific disk. Huge! One of my external backup drives finally gave up the ghost so I bought this to replace it. Fortunately, my habit is to back up critical files to two external drives, so I lost nothing. Being a serious amateur photographer, I have tons of files to protect. The only unavoidable hitch is that to copy all the backup files to this disk takes a very long time (days) Not the disk's fault, there is just so many files.and gigabytes of data.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sabes

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THE SEAGATE DRIVE THAT I HAVE PURCHASED HAS FAILED. THE THING IS IT ALWAYS FAILS AFTER MY WARRANTY EXPIRES AND ALWAYS SUDDENLY. THIS IS THE FINAL STRAW. IT TOOK YEARS OF DATA WITH IT. YET I HAVE WD HARD DRIVES THAT ARE OVER 10 YEARS OLD THAT STILL FUNCTION PERFECTLY. I DONT EVEN KNOW WHY I PURCHASED THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to register.
customer_reviews.text: This drive was supposed to come with 200 GB of OneDrive space. when trying to register this drive on-line it did not recognize the serial number so I could not register the product to receive the cloud space. After writing to Seagate why it woud not recongize the serial # they requested an invoice and pictures from the drive and the box. It seems that the registration department had no idea about this drive. Finally after a few days a nd telling them I would send the drive back I could register it. But all together it was a hassle to get this going.
customer_reviews.author: WernerJB

customer_reviews.title: Spin it up, run backups, spin it down and store it safely elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I use this for snapshot disaster-recovery backups when my system or its data has changed enough to merit another snapshot. The USB-3.0 speed means a snapshot runs in minutes where the previous drive I had been using, with its USB-2.0 interface, took much longer. I store it elsewhere, in a sealed bag in a metal cabinet, rather than at my system, just in case the disaster were not a disk failure but say a fire, or storm damage from a falling tree limb.
customer_reviews.author: F. Korz

customer_reviews.title: I really love it, I wish they had a 16
customer_reviews.text: I really love it, I wish they had a 16, 32, or 64 TB version... I filled up the 8 TB so quickly, and it can get loud at times, but it has never failed... I can't wait for the USB type c version, so it won't need a USB output and a large power supply too, when using this for my laptop or my ps4 I still need to find a outlet for this, that gets really annoying
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence E Osborne Jr

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Reasonably Priced
customer_reviews.text: As this has several different versions here on Amazon, to clarify I purchased the 4TB option of this external hard drive for a Windows-based machine. I’ve been using this external hard drive for almost three years and it has performed like a champ. Installation and setup was very easy, and my regular backups of important files are automatic with Seagate’s included software. The cost per gig of storage is very reasonable. If you are looking for a reliable external storage I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Initially it worked fine and the data transfer were happening at a Good ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Hard disk on 12th March. Initially it worked fine and the data transfer were happening at a Good rate of 28MB/s, but after 3 to 4 uses the data transfer rate has been thoroughly decreased down to 1MB/s which is not acceptable at all. It's not happening for one or any specific file. It's happening for each and every cases. Now the the Data Transfer has really become the worst nightmare i.e 1 MB/s. Please let me know for the cause behind it. As previously, I am using many Hard disks on the same PC but never faced such a worst situation. Truly not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jatin Prakash

customer_reviews.title: Best reliable external hard drive I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, it's really good external hard drive. Not only it was pretty affordable for 3TB but older model are more reliable than the latest model. Best part of this hard drive is, my MacBook goes to sleep without shutting down, the hard drive shut off automatically and then cool off. At the same time, the computer and hard drive both wake up so I don't have to replug or disconnect the hard drive. But there's con: desktop external hard drive couldn't connect to my Roku player as the portable Seagate ones normally works with the Roku. All I have to use Plex on Roku while new desktop external hard drive connected to my computer but the performance does look good.
customer_reviews.author: MP2999

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works well
customer_reviews.text: A straightforward, no-frills backup drive, the included software has essential functions like timed backup and, if connected to a computer on your network, wireless backup for Android and iOS devices. Manual backup from computer, tablets, and phones works flawlessly over wi-fi, but scheduled backups over wireless seems a bit hit or miss when the mobile devices--and the drive itself--go into sleep mode. Since I'm paranoid about backing up data, it's not that big of a deal to me because I perform manual backups regularly, but be aware that you'll want to check the backup logs frequently until you're sure you have everything set up, tweaked, and working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drive, Very Fast
customer_reviews.text: Nice hard drive, very fast. I have seen write speeds up to about 1.2Gb/s. Way faster than my USB 2 drives. I use this drive for backing up my files into compressed zips then dump the files from this drive to my Tape backup.
customer_reviews.author: John Behring

customer_reviews.title: The drive makes far too much noise to be acceptable
customer_reviews.text: The drive makes far too much noise to be acceptable. Requires external power through a wall transformer, and makes noise that sounds either like constant disk spinning, or fan. No place on the product's description was it made obvious that the the drive requires external AC power, nor that it makes noise. Vastly quieter (silent) options of same storage capacity and speed are available.
customer_reviews.author: S. Saroff

customer_reviews.title: Massive Capacity!
customer_reviews.text: Love the large size of this. You can buy several, and have a good library of your favorite movies, videos, music, ISOs, VMs, and backups (you are making backups of your treasured photos and videos, right?) No need for an expensive SAN/NAS (unless you want to share your data with your family). Put your precious stuff on here (including pictures of your valuables for insurance reasons), and give it to your (trusted) relatives, or put it in a safety deposit box for safe keeping in case something happens to your home. This holds 8-16 times the typical computer hard drive of 500GB or 1TB in size.
customer_reviews.author: ADudePlayingADude

customer_reviews.title: A reliable drive that's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Seagate 4tb drive (I don't like to erase anything). This drive met my expectations. It is fast and reliable. If you are copying your old files to this drive, you might want to look for a utility to keep the old creation dates. Otherwise, they will all have the date you copied them. That might be a bad surprise for you. It's interesting to not, if you're old enough to have been there, that this drive costs less than a 100gb drive did when they were released.
customer_reviews.author: VLaslow

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust Seagate with your data
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these seagate 8tb dries and a couple of WD mybook 8tbs. Both the Seagates have failed while the Mybooks are fine. Not much use - basically I filled then once, emptied them and was refilling them - and that was the point at which they both failed. I used to use Seagate over a decade ago but had terrible reliability issues - I was giving them another chance. Big mistake. What more is there to say? My data is far too important to trust it to Seagate. Never again, no second chances. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately I only lost the files on My SSD C
customer_reviews.text: This item does not appear to be Windows 10 compatible. I bought it to back up my system because my OS became corrupted. I downloaded the Dashboard from the website and tried to do the back up. I t would not read anything from either my C: or D: drives. I had to reset My OS without any backup. Fortunately I only lost the files on My SSD C: drives and could recover from that. After repairing my OS I tried to back up my drives to the Seagate with exactly the same results. It would not transfer. Additionally directions/Manual are virtually non existent. Used to have great regard for Seagate....not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Rizon538

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 MB Per Second (BAD, BAD, BAD)
customer_reviews.text: Using a Seagate Backup Plus hard drive (USB 3.0) on a Mac computer with Time Machine software has a transfer rate of 2.5 MB per seconds from my experience using a 2014 Macbook Pro. This is unacceptable for a 5 TB drive when I planned on transferring 2.2 TB. This would take 242 hours for the first transfer. A Seagate representative thought it was a Time Machine issue. Therefore this is a useless device on a Mac Computer having no acceptable software to run it for its intended use. Maybe there is a third party software vender that can capitalize on this problem.
customer_reviews.author: research

customer_reviews.title: 4TB of mobile storage...
customer_reviews.text: I've trusted Seagate since the 70's & 80's when they produced 8" & 5-1/4" FLOPPY drives. Yep, I'm THAT old! This drive is rugged, though I never advocate dropping ANY H.D.D., I accidentally did, and it survived it. It works with a USB 3.0 connection, but it is backward compatible with connecting it to your 2.0 USB port on your computer. It's near silent. Until SSD's get to this stage, It's a worthy investment. Why 5 stars? PRICE!!! Under $200.00!!!! That's always a good selling point for me, when I can get quality goods, at a GREAT price!
customer_reviews.author: J. Niccolls

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good paperweight...
customer_reviews.text: Drive initially worked fine with my old Dell Inspiron E1705 XP3 system. However, like a previous Seagate model, after only about a week of use it started generating the dreaded BSOD. "Support" from Seagate was seriously lacking and unhelpful. Amazon came through with a refund. Take your chances and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: B B Brown

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely user UNFRIENDLY, power connection disappeared into the unit within 3 weeks, therefore no way to power up as usb connection disappeared into the unit. NO way to open unit to try to fix the sloppy construction. BUY ANYTHING except this product! Tried many times to fix this inferior, poorly constructed product. Tonight, it will rest at the bottom of my trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Paprikajancsi

customer_reviews.title: Seagate finally has a great drive.
customer_reviews.text: Had lots of trouble with previous Seagate models (the standups), but this lie flat version is great. I've got four of them (3 5TB's and this 8TB) stacked on one another. They run quiet and cool and no problems yet. The previous versions ran very hot, made occasional noise, had odd occasional errors, and all broke down under warranty. Seagate was good about replacing them (with refurbs) but it will still a hassle. I even had refurbs replaced with "new" refurbs when the first replacements broke. This new model looks to be very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product....but my mistake caused my own problems!
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but I really messed up!! Received from Amazon in May. I had to leave the day after delivery for a several month international trip. Finally got around to opening it just today and there was absolutely NO information in the sealed box---product was NEW. My complaint is not the product but the lack of quality control by the manufacture or shipper (?) to insure important documentation is included. I will attempt to sort this out by doing some Google diving. I'm not extremely 'tech' savy, so this process may be very frustrating. SO my word to those wiser than I was....open your product immediately to do a quick check of contents.
customer_reviews.author: Yaj

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: 5TB space should hold up for a long time I would think. Unit plugged in with no problem into my wireless router so I can use it to back up all the computers in my house that connect to it. I've had it almost a month now and no issues. My last backup drive failed after two years. (It happened to be a Seagate, which i did not remember when I bought this one, or I might have steered clear). Hopefully it was an anomaly. I did by the $10 backup warranty Amazon offered, so if I do have problems I can send it in for data recovery.
customer_reviews.author: average joe

customer_reviews.title: So far I am pleased with this drive
customer_reviews.text: So far I am pleased with this drive. I would, in fact, buy another one except for one thing. The drive appears to be available only bundled with the 200G One Drive account. However, only ONE upgrade per One Drive account can be applied if I read the description correctly. That means that if I buy a second drive I have to pay for the OneDrive upgrade but I don't get it. Perhaps I am missing something but it would seem to be highly desirable for this drive to be available unbundled. As the claim is made that the OneDrive upgrade is something like a 90.00 value the unbundled drive ought to be cheaper by at least half that.
customer_reviews.author: charles cicciarella

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent power-up issues make this drive unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Drive purchased in May 2016. For the first 3 years the drive worked fine. Now the drive intermittently fails to power-up. The power-on LED does not illuminate and the drive does not appear on the connected laptop. Removing and re-connecting the power connector eventually (after multiple attempts) resolves the problem. I don't know how much longer this solution will work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great storage at a great price....but
customer_reviews.text: Great storage at a great price! Four stars only because it is a bit noisy and slower than my other external drives. Since I only use it for my Lightroom photos, and don't have it on all the time, I can live with these issues. If anything else occurs, I'll post an edit to this review. Update: The drive is still working, but it is so darn loud! I have a WD 4TB that is extremely quiet. Since I only use this Seagate drive for Lightroom photos, I eject it once I've finished with LR, because of the noise. Other than the noise, the drive has been stable and I have no other complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandylp

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Data storage space
customer_reviews.text: Works Well. I'm using this to hold my Steam games. I haven't noticed any issues in speed running my games from this hard drive which is nice since i heard games might not run as well if running from external hard drives. 5 TB is a large amount of storage ( I haven't even used 1 TB yet) which should be sufficient at backing up just about anything. Also, it is pretty small. Mine is somewhat hidden but even in plain sight on your desk it won't take up much physical space while giving you lots of data storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael

customer_reviews.title: Great spare drive, backup drive
customer_reviews.text: Great spare drive that I purchased when upgrading my RAID array capacity. Great storage that has proven stable over time, and works well in nearly any non-critical capacity. Power consumption is low enough and it will power down when not in use for long periods, so it negates the need to unplug and replug (mount/dismount). Should I exceed my RAID capacity, I'll be looking for more of these to handle the data migration. Recommend very highly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Andrew Buck

customer_reviews.title: let the ships come directly from Amazon's packaging was very good. All'm sure my computer's HDD are bought in ...
customer_reviews.text: First of all, let the ships come directly from Amazon's packaging was very good. All'm sure my computer's HDD are bought in 7-8 years the situation has even they needed to upgrade the product price is affordable and the quality is satisfactory. Come to me, the quality of the HDD Seagate when I heard talk about other people's bad, I buy myself very satisfied. Affordable once again gave thanks to Amazon to sell the stuff.
customer_reviews.author: maru

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quiet Desktop Drive, has an independent power supply.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I installed and software and started backing up right away. No issues at this moment will post again if problems occur. Seagate / WD. I prefer Seagate and it appears to have better rating, if WD was cheaper I would buy it. At time of my purchase Seagate had both a better price and ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent external storage solution, I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly the first time I plugged it in, and every time since. i have a MacBook Pro and my old backup solution was getting long in the tooth. I did some web searching and saw good ratings for this unit. I plugged it in anticipating more difficulties like I have had with my Western Digital Passports or MyBook, but so far after several weeks, I have not had one problem, Zip, Zero, Zilch. It is ALWAYS recognized by my computer. NEVER a glitch. The USB 3.0 speed is noticeably better than my old drive. This is the best, easiest to use, most reliable backup solution I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: On the bright side, it lasted 4 years of continuous use hooked up to my Xbox One, but now it won't work. I can't access any games on the drive or copy anything to the drive. 4 years maybe isn't too bad, but I expected it to at least last the life span of my Xbox.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeGilkey5

customer_reviews.title: Done with Seagate
customer_reviews.text: I received this four days ago and just as the last external drive I purchased from Seagate had done, the USB 3 connection no longer functions. It is that way on all of my computers. I checked a flash drive on the USB 3 plug-ins and that worked so it is not at my end.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Knight

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived a day late, but I am glad to have made this purchase. When I purchased my laptop I wasn't involved in photography. Now that I am (and shooting raw) my small hard-drive quickly filled up. I purchased this external had drive and I have transfered all my photographs to it (which are thousands) and it took less than 30 minutes to do so connected with the USB 3 cable. I do notice a little difference when working for the external than my internal hard-drive, but it's not excessive, just a bit noticeable. It is a life-saver though! It was plug and play, and looks exactly as it was described.
customer_reviews.author: Minorca

customer_reviews.title: Losing precious memories is infuriating
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was great when I bought it. But to no fault of mine the hard drive FILLED with precious photos and videos locked up. But alas, I bought the Recovery plan Ah Ha! After weeks of waiting, Seagate was nice enough to tell me that I lost all my Data and it is un-recoverable, however they will return my corrupt hard drive (it'll make a lovely door stop). At least (after asking) they are sending a replacement hard drive because this one crapped out before the warranty period was up. So I'll soon have another few TB's to lose! Thanks Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence L. Granit

customer_reviews.title: A great way to get loads of cheap storage.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these and they are all working well. They do have the issue that sometimes write speed will slow from the normal 70-90MB/s to a crawl e.g.: 12 MB/s however this seems to be happening less and less over time (although this might be due to mine being fairly full and it writing primarily on the outside -faster- part of the platter). I can recommend them but consider that they do have slowdowns in write speed.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Any one need a 5TB Seagate Hard drive to use as a door stop?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item in July, 2015. I put it on line with a new desktop (for "reliable backup" reasons). As of yesterday (Jan 1, 2015) this great backup unit IS DEAD, UNREADABLE. (Thank goodness for multiple level backups, Western Digital bailed me out, again.) THIS IS THE LAST TIME THAT Seagate IS GOING TO CATCH ME SLEEPING.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley J. Cloward

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to have alternative backup for this backup. ...
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to have alternative backup for this backup. I don't know but maybe it's just be that expects a hard drive to last longer than 16 months. I've lost hundreds of dollars in graphic aids I bought for my scrapbooking business because this drive died.
customer_reviews.author: Rose S.

customer_reviews.title: Rough Start - OK now...
customer_reviews.text: First 5TB HDD I received basically died as soon as I plugged it into my Mac. Fortunately the second one (after a slightly rough start) worked out. It's been humming along for ~1/2 a year now. We'll see how it continues to perform... UPDATE: Well, it's been ~ a year now since I've purchased this HDD and it's been humming along perfectly so far. Gave it another star because of that. We'll see how this HDD performs after another year. :)
customer_reviews.author: BadAndy

customer_reviews.title: Crashed After Less Than 2 Years' Use
customer_reviews.text: This drive had never been moved from it's location behind my iMac, sitting flat on top of a 300 lb. desk. I used it solely as a Time Machine backup. It suddenly failed without any previous indications of performance issues.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Podvoll

customer_reviews.title: Works a treat so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 separate Seagate external drives over the past 2 years, and only one so far has failed, and Seagate replaced it under warranty. This drive has been humming along since I bought it with no problems so far, and with the drivers available from Seagate, worked fine on a Windows XP machine, and a Windows 7 machine without reformatting. It also showed up just fine in all the Macs I used it with. One minor point, this drive is better suited to sitting flat on a desk, and looks like it was designed with that orientation in mind, despite the fact that it is standing in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schiffmacher

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for my Xbox One!
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade for my Xbox One! I bought this since my console capacity was just 500GB and I filled it up with game updates and a few digital games. Installation was tricky but easy. At first it didn't worked, so I followed some internet advices by disconnecting it while the console was on and plugged it back and voila! It worked perfectly. It download games pretty fast and the upload I'd say its pretty much the same. For $120, 5TB its the beast deal. Highly recommended if you're short on console capacity. and its pretty well disguised next to the console.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Last just over 3-years and then fail
customer_reviews.text: I swear these hard drives are made to last exactly 3 years and 1 day so it will be out of warranty when it fails. Like a time-bomb or something. I've purchased 2 of these exact drives at different times and both times they failed right after the 3-year warranty expired. I'll be looking for a different drive manufacturer from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S Condon

customer_reviews.title: Drive is excellent; software is cumbersome and slow (not anymore - review & stars edited)
customer_reviews.text: The drive has worked perfectly since arrival. It was packaged well, also. The software is cumbersome and slow to access and the one thing I wish the software did was indicate a successful (or not) backup after completion. As a healthy paranoid user who backs up daily, I have to go into the (cumbersome and slow to access) software to find out if indeed the backup was successful. It always has - thank goodness. I edited the stars from 4 to 5 because the software update plus the manufacturer's response about the icon changing color for success/failure indication address one of my software issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Long

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with older operating systems
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the same model as some older (1 year) drives I have and work well. Turns out, despite the same model name and appearance, it only works with Windows 8 and higher, so I can only use it with some of my computers but not others, which a major pain for incompatibility for my computing environment. If you only use Windows 8 and above, these drive work well, and seem as reliable as any hard drive gets now days. In that sense they deserve 4 stars. But if incompatibility with older operating systems is a requirement for you (as it is for me), these are not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. George

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, needs separate power outlet.
customer_reviews.text: So far working great. Speeds are faster than my 5200rpm drive. Did not realize it needed a power outlet until I received the product, so you should keep that in mind. Otherwise I have had no reliability problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and great price / TB
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for me out of the box. Plugged it into a USB port and it was very quiet - like you forget it is there. Initial tests showed no errors. I copied files with the click and drag method. The backup program it comes with seems very simple to set up and use - backs up your cloud, phone, and PCs. I have yet to use this though. My first use of this device was to consolidate all my other drives to one place so I could start re-organizing them from scratch. It has worked great for this. Black Friday pricing was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: TechMan

customer_reviews.title: The price per GB value is too good to pass.
customer_reviews.text: I avoid Seagate normally. The price per GB value is too good to pass. It's been working for a year and I keep everything on it backed up to another drive. I'd never use this drive as my only external backup. The USB3 is fast and it survived being onboard a ship for 2 months at sea (obviously inside where it is DRY).
customer_reviews.author: A. Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: This is primarily in response to a number of the reviews. I work with large libraries of patient data, and needed to shuffle about 6TB from remote servers to my PC internal HD, to this drive as a back-up. 6TB moved through those connections moved at about 1.5MB/sec (remote server was the transfer limit) - about 45 days continuous operation to transfer. No problem. The drive was only ever warm, not hot. Every file appears to verify, although I'll need until sometime in 2025 before I can complete an honest SH5 check.
customer_reviews.author: James W Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I wanted and a bit more
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $129 and what a steal it was. This thing works like a charm! Not only does it upload quickly and easily over WiFi, but you can customize the drive to become inactive after X minutes. It will wake up when you try to upload something to it. At 5 TB, it's well worth it. My wife takes a lot of pics on her iPhone and runs out of space quickly. I have her phone set to auto backup now through their app. It even tells you when it last backed up and knows not to copy files that have already been copied.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Folsom

customer_reviews.title: Don't ever drop it!
customer_reviews.text: Don't ever drop it! Being naieve, I thought it was much sturdier than it is. I dropped it on the floor and lost all the records I had stored after copying the data from the exhausted memory on my laptop. My tech could not retrieve it. I bought the service plan but my husband just left it at the shop where it was tossed out! So much for planning ahead. Now I just pray that the cloud will be a reliable storage place for my documents and photos.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jarrells

customer_reviews.title: never have i had such a bad experience with a hard drive i just dont think ...
customer_reviews.text: this hard drive simply does not work with my mac, do not make the same mistake i did and buy it, i even sent it to the manufacturer thinking it was defective and they sent me a new one and it didnt work either....i formatted the drive and it appears on the desktop but anytime you try to copy anything to it the drive just freezes...never have i had such a bad experience with a hard drive i just dont think they are capable of making a 8tb cheap hard drive, go for the 5tb or 4th dont waste your time with this one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Backups or Media, this one does it all!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a backup device for my gaming PC and it absolutely SWALLOWS all the data without a hiccup. Runs like a champ, doesn't get hot, and hasn't "dropped" once since I got it. Got another one and hooked it up to an old laptop. Currently acting as the media server for my whole house. No problems. Now all I have to do is talk my wife into letting me get one for every computer in the house for backups. All those potential headaches... just gone in a flash...
customer_reviews.author: Remy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It crashed and burned within a year. Luckily, it was within the warranty time. Seagate sent me a replacement that was NOT NEW BUT "RECERTIFIED." It is not working correctly, either. I also bought an extended 2 year warranty through Amazon. I think that warrants getting a "NEW" replacement, not a reconditioned one. And it would be nice to get one that works!!
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Good drive
customer_reviews.text: It was one of the cheapest drives at the time and it still works great. I am actually happy with purchase, and with amount of storage these days you double the storage after couple years anywas. probably would not use it for backups though.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar hanzely

customer_reviews.title: best hard drive i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: this hard drive is amazing. worked great from day one. installation and set up was a breeze and has so much space for the first time ever i'm having a hard time filling it up. i purchased the data recovery plan and have yet to even think i will need it as this thing seems to work flawlessly. used mostly for my business files, picture back ups from our phones, digital cameras etc, videos, and music back up of our itunes library and more. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!! i've owned 7 different hard drives over the years and i like this one the best for many reasons, including ease of use and the style.
customer_reviews.author: Sanborn Family

customer_reviews.title: Great drive; killer value.
customer_reviews.text: Its a HDD. That is a monster. 5TB for a little over a Benny....are you kidding me?!? Every time I take a look at drives, I'm blown away as I recall my first (HUGE at the time) 20Mb apple drive, ca. '85, that was the size of a phone book and cost $2500! LOL Gotta love progress...
customer_reviews.author: Vince224

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointed that this 5TB is actually only about 4
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say really. It is truly plug and play and quietly does it's job. Kind of disappointed that this 5TB is actually only about 4.5 (I understand why.. I'm jus sayin). Still it's a lot of storage for the price. This unit was smaller than I was expecting and that was a pleasant surprise. A disappointing feature is that while most manufacturers have gone to intelligent plug designs that only take up one spot in a power strip, this one is old style and will cover several outlets unless you can place it on the end.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart N. Grant

customer_reviews.title: It fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to store a lot of data easily, and this was it for me. All you have to do is plug it in, wait for your computer to acknowledge it (usually takes just a few seconds), then open of the drive and start copy and pasting (or cutting and pasting) any files into it that you want. GREAT way to store movies, music, and shows if you have a lot of Mp4 and Mp3 files for example. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cato

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is Better, get the 8 TB.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger is Better. Rather than messing around with my 2, 4, & 5 TB external drives, buying the 8 TB was a great investment as it uses only the one USB3.0 port and I was able to store the data from my other drives onto just one. It has been running non-stop for several weeks as it is being backed up to off-line service (Backblaze). No heat issues and silent. Works great, no problems, and for around $200-220 it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: so good. I'm using it to store my Lightroom library
customer_reviews.text: I have had the drive for about a month now. So far, so good. I'm using it to store my Lightroom library. The cable that comes with it is a good length. No issues with the power supply. Drive sounds good. Failure does not seem imminent. Edges and corners are rather sharp. Housing is extremely glossy and attracts fingerprints if protected film is removed.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Seagate drives are usually garbage, But decided to take a chance
customer_reviews.text: Seagate drives are usually garbage, But decided to take a chance. Spent a year deployed with it, has been abused and the thing works like a champ with this crappy 220 Voltage. I had to buy another one to have a ready available backup. Not one heat or issue with either drive. And for the price it's really hard to pass up. If Seagate keeps this up they can have a reputation again. I hope it doesn't die like every other Seagate drive I ever owned. Please don't die!
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great for a digital backup!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is now backed up. I have ripped all of my 1,000+ movies, 10,000+ cds etc...to this drive. Everything fits nicely on this drive albeit tightly based upon the seriously high size of my collection so I will be ordering another drive soon to have a duplicate copy of my collection in case of a fail so I don't have to rip everything again. Very happy to have it all backed up!
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable on Win 8.1
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Well it has been stable for the past couple of months. Not sure what changed. I see the price has increased on Amazon (over $210) which makes it too expensive now. ===== So far it has just been a problem. While it initially loaded 3TB of content, since then using it to backup any more just gives unreliable access. Not sure if it is a driver issue, but Win8.1 isn't suggesting a change. Until some fix comes to light, I wouldn't consider buying another. My 5, 4 and 3TB disks all still work fine.
customer_reviews.author: ecommercer

product_meta.title: Seagate Backup Plus 3TB Desktop External Hard Drive USB 3.0 (STDT3000100)
product_meta.description: Style:PC| Capacity:3 TBSeagateBackup Plus Desktop drives are available in capacities up to 8TB and come with a USB 3.0 hub option. With cross-platform compatibility, exceptional reliability and speed, you can back up just about everything. Plus you can conveniently back up and share your digital favorites with the included cloud storage service.
feature_bullets: High-speed USB 3.0 and 2.0 connectivity offers plug-and-play functionality on your PC.
Install the NTFS driver for Mac, and you can use the drive interchangeably between Windows and Mac computers without reformatting.
Run a one-click backup or schedule an automatic backup plan to protect your files in your Backup Plus desktop drive at your convenience with Seagate Dashboard software
Works interchangeably on PC and Mac computers—without needing to reformat

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,396 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
